Strong stakeholder engagement and management skills

Background in information governance transformation and business improvements

Experience with stakeholder engagement

About us. 

Urbis is more than just a consultancy.   We are a multidisciplinary urban consultancy, inspiring and creating solutions for our ever-changing world.   We empower our brightest minds with opportunities to push boundaries, collaborate and deliver exceptional, creative solutions for our clients and each other.

If you're looking to make transformational impact in our cities and communities, we're keen to meet you. 

We pride ourselves on empowering our employees and supporting them to be the best they can be. Here you will make a tangible difference and create positive impact, while gaining enviable industry experience and broad exposure to the most exciting work.

The opportunity & how you will make an impact. 

 

As an Associate Director at Urbis, you will play a key role in delivering rigorous, evidence-based advice to public and private sector clients, while building long-term relationships and supporting business growth. You will lead the delivery of complex projects, ensuring work is completed to a high technical standard, on time and within budget.

Drawing on your economic expertise, you will undertake and oversee socio-economic analysis, cost-benefit analysis and market assessment to inform strategic decision-making across a range of sectors. You will contribute to business cases and investment frameworks where required, alongside the development of economic strategies and action plans that support long-term economic and community outcomes.

This role is well suited to an experienced Senior Consultant ready to step into a leadership position, or an Associate Director seeking broader economic advisory exposure. Experience across renewable energy, industrial and innovation precincts, employment lands, or public infrastructure will be highly regarded.

This opportunity is open to candidates across all Urbis office locations (NSW, VIC, WA and QLD).

In this role, you will:

Deliver high-quality market research and economic/property analysis across a diverse range of projects
Build and maintain strong client relationships to generate new business opportunities
Conduct socio-economic and cost-benefit analysis
Author business cases and investment logic maps
Develop economic development strategies and action plans
Lead project management activities, including budgeting, forecasting, and resource allocation
Support and mentor staff, fostering a positive, inclusive, and high-performing team culture
Collaborate with other business units to identify synergies and support business growth
Contribute to the ongoing development and improvement of workplace health, safety, and compliance practices

 

 

About you. 

We are looking for talented professionals who are purpose-driven, collaborative, and thrive in high-performing environments. You will ideally have:

Proven experience in consultancy, ideally within the property or economics sector.
Strong commercial acumen with the ability to manage contracts, budgets, and deliverables independently.
Excellent technical skills, including advanced Microsoft Office capabilities (Power Pivot, DAX, Index/Match).
Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills, with a track record of mentoring and developing teams.
A solutions-oriented mindset with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and confidently.

We are passionate about purpose with impact. You'll join an organisation united by a shared goal: shaping cities and communities for a better future. We invest in your growth, with inspirational leadership experiences, structured development pathways and the freedom to lead your own way. We empower you to shape your career and your impact.
We believe in flexible benefits, performance-driven rewards and experiences that support you both professionally and personally—because what matters to you, matters to us.

Ad Text:
Are you a senior HR technology leader with a passion for transforming HR systems end-to-end?

We're partnering with a large organisation embarking on a major HRIS transformation and we're looking for a hands-on HR Architect / Delivery Lead to help shape and deliver the future-state HR technology landscape.

This role is perfect for someone who thrives at the intersection of strategy, architecture and delivery, and who is excited about leveraging emerging AI and automation technologies to modernise HR operations.

What you'll be doing:

Lead the discovery, design and delivery of a modern, integrated HRIS stack across core HR, payroll, talent and analytics platforms
Define the target architecture, integration layers and data flows to ensure seamless operation across HR, Finance and other enterprise systems
Collaborate closely with HR, Technology, Finance and external vendors to deliver scalable, future-ready solutions
Evaluate vendor solutions, perform cost-benefit analyses and guide selection decisions
Champion the adoption of agentic AI, automation and advanced HR tech use cases where appropriate
Provide hands-on leadership, guidance and oversight to project teams to ensure delivery on-time, on-budget, and to specification

What we're looking for:

Extensive experience leading enterprise HRIS transformations
Strong HRIS architecture capability across core HR, payroll, talent and analytics platforms
Proven experience in integration design, data architecture and system rationalisation
Familiarity with emerging HR technologies, including agentic AI, automation and workforce analytics
Demonstrated ability to perform vendor evaluations, cost-benefit analyses and technology selection
Strong stakeholder management and communication skills, with experience influencing senior executives and cross-functional teams

This is a high-impact, hands-on opportunity to lead a meaningful HR technology uplift. You'll influence long-term operating models, improve HR processes across the organisation and play a key role in shaping the employee experience.

Contact Nick Largent for more information.

Job description:



EnergyAustralia is currently building out multiple squads to ensure successful delivery of the Customer Department Transformation program.
